author: Natalia Rachlin
title: An Iconic Danish Designer Will Relaunch Furniture Pieces
text:
WEARING A FRIZZY beige floor-length coat and a knitted chartreuse beanie pulled down low, 86-year-old Danish architect and designer Bodil Kjær stands inside the central courtyard of a monastery in the heart of Aarhus, Denmark, sharing the secrets to longevity. She believes that good food, moderate amounts of very good wine, little medication and an almost obstinate sense of positivity—not to be confused with persistent agreeability—have done the trick for her. “I’ve also always known my own mind,” she says, “and I’ve never kissed ass.”
